conclusion: Analyze forces on wire ab due to magnetic field and spring scales.
Wire ab has length L, carries current I, magnetic field B into paper, spring scales read F1.
Magnetic force on conductor is Fm = BIL.
Magnetic force directed out of paper, adds to wire weight, tension T = mg + BIL.
Spring scale reads F1, so F1 = mg + BIL.
Current reversed, magnitude becomes 2I, force direction changes.
New magnetic force Fm' = 2BIL, subtracts from weight, tension T' = mg - 2BIL.
Spring scale reads F2, so F2 = mg - 2BIL.
Magnitude of magnetic field B is (F1 - F2) / (3IL).
